MENTOR
CAI language. "Computer Systems for Teaching Complex Concepts", Report 1742, BBN, Mar 1969.

Mentor, KS Zip code(s): 67465 Mentor, KY (city, FIPS 51564) Location: 38.89063 N, 84.24369 W Population (1990): 169 (68 housing units) Area: 1.4 sq km (land), 0.1 sq km (water) Mentor, MN (city, FIPS 41714) Location: 47.69663 N, 96.14467 W Population (1990): 94 (51 housing units) Area: 4.9 sq km (land), 0.0 sq km (water) Zip code(s): 56736 Mentor, OH (city, FIPS 49056) Location: 41.69153 N, 81.33445 W Population (1990): 47358 (17172 housing units) Area: 69.3 sq km (land), 3.4 sq km (water) Zip code(s): 44060

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Mentor \Men"tor\, n. [From Mentor, the counselor of Telemachus, Gr. Me`ntwr, prop., counselor. Cf. {Monitor}.] A wise and faithful counselor or monitor. [1913 Webster]

mentor n : a wise and trusted guide and advisor [syn: {wise man}] v : serve as a teacher or trusted counselor; "The famous professor mentored him during his years in graduate school"; "She is a fine lecturer but she doesn't like mentoring"
